Systemd-nspawn for fun and...well, mostly for fun
/post/2016-02-07-systemd-nspawn-for-fun-and-well-mostly-f/ 2016-02-07T00:00:00+0000 2016-02-07T00:00:00+0000 systemd-nspawn has been called “chroot on steroids”, but if you think of it as Docker with a slightly different target you wouldn’t be far wrong, either. It can be used to spawn containers on your host, and has a variety of options for configuring the containerized environment through the use of private networking, bind mounts, capability controls, and a variety of other facilities that give you flexible container management.
